parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: A prolonged form of a primary heuro, which heureo is used for it in all the tenses except the present and imperfect to find.
To accuse, charge, prosecute. From kategoros; to be a plaintiff, i.e. To charge with some offence.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From gramma. A writer, i.e. scribe or secretary.
Of Hebrew origin; a separatist, i.e. Exclusively religious; a Pharisean, i.e. Jewish sectary.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To watch, observe scrupulously. From para and tereo; to inspect alongside, i.e. Note insidiously or scrupulously.
If. A primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From the same as therapon; to wait upon menially, i.e. to adore, or to relieve.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
